Well, granted the game is an interesting idea. Maybe if it were redone, updated, and given new life, it would be worth playing.

As it stands, the game is old... and dead. Next to nobody plays. And honestly, it's not too fun in the current form anyway. Many games nowadays are repetitive, but this is just boring repetitive. I have played a total of 5 minutes! That is next to nothing, but it was enough to see what the game is.

In any case, nobody is going to buy this game by itself, I figure. It's just coming with the Valve Pack.

Ricochet is truly an underrated masterpiece.
You play as an unnamed warrior, sent into outer space with no weapons or supplies, leaving you to scavenge loose discs left from broken ships. You learn to use these discs to fend off against enemies. The thing about this game, though, is its primary theme of isolation. Rarely will you encounter other forms of life, creating a lonely, brooding atmosphere, perfect for the game's outer space setting. For its price, I highly recommend Ricochet. Definitely Valve's greatest achievement.
10/10 -Doki

I can't think of a better game on Steam. If you can drop the cash for it, it's a wonderful drop-in/drop-out multiplayer game. Simple premise, concise story, easy to understand weaponry, it's all here. The best part of all is that you don't have to worry about a pesky jump function. This is more than definitely worth the cash, and the community is phenomenal as well.

Ricochet to me at first was that game VALVe made that they didn't like to talk about. That they wished people didn't remember. I could see why; it was a really small, simple, low def game. in other words to some people, trash. I'm not really sure when I got ricochet, as it was probably included in a counter-strike pack of sorts. I recently held a LAN party with 2 of my friends and we didn't really have any multi-player games to play, so jokingly I said "Hey guys, let's play Ricochet!" As luck would have it, they had the game too, so we installed and played it. My first impression of this small, 3-map game was "This is gonna suck" but as time went on, we all had a blast laughing at the low-quality screams of falling into a huge pink spinning vortex after being hit in the face by a high-speed disk. If you choose to buy Ricochet, get it in a pack where it's just an included game and don't expect any online servers; rather, play with some good friends and I assure you you'll have a great time.

Across the myriad titles released in this game's generation and beyond, there has never been one quite as unique, quite as diverse, as Ricochet. In both style and execution, this game exceeds what the players, and, I think, the developers, had in store for the experience. It brings you into its world and immerses you in its culture from the very title screen, urging you to play more, to investigate, explore, and really see your environment from the viewpoint of your character. It does this not by throwing you into lengthy, drawn-out cinematics, but with control and movement unparalleled in any game to date, graphics unrivaled by even the largest of studios, and combat so immersive, so unmatched, that no other game can quite compare. No matter what advancements may visit videogames in the future, it's quite certain that Ricochet will always be a masterpiece, a paragon of ground-breaking gameplay and graphics, right up there with Dongers 3: The Revengening and Hello Kitty Island Resort: Uncensored Version.

Words cannot describe the epic and intense storyline. Missions include searching for servers that people are actually on, fighting bots, and attemping to figure out the complex controls. Who knows, will YOU survive in the dangerous world of Ricochet?
The best game of all time, brought to you by Valve. This game makes The Last of Us, Bioshock, Half Life 2 its bitch. Buy this game now, truly next gen was here back in November 1, 2000.

This game is what defines gaming. It is a first person shooter puzzler platformer with a huge community and an amazing amount of content. The single player is absolutely fantastic with characters with so much depth and a story that sucks you in. The gameplay itself is addicting and enticing with every moment being intense. Sadly this game lacks a sequel but with the masterpeice it already is it doesn't need one.

I like this game. I like it a lot in all honestly. This combines so many good elements of what Valve is capable of, you really don't need anymore games after this. This is seriously the only game on Steam you need. All those other games like, oh, what, Call of Duty: Toasts, Team Hatress 2, Half-Life 2. I mean, come on? Why would Valve make a game only half finished and call it just that? What, you didn't know? That's why it's called Half-Life. HALF-Life. HALF. As in, HALF finished. Read a book people. Going back to Ricochet. This game makes me feel good when I play it. I like to play this game with my friends, Tim and Bob, on the weekends. This game helps me relive all of my TRON: Legacy fantasies. Some say if you play on the right servers (which are rumored to be hidden and only accessable by inputing a hexadecimal IP into the console), you are able to play with Daft Punk themselves. But if you're super lucky. you'll be getting lucky because Pharrell Williams will also be joining you on the server. Talk about Get Lucky, right? Right? RIGHT?! You could imagine my excitment when I heard that Ricochet 2 is being developed and will be released by the end of 2014. I mean, the internet said it would be, and the internet has been proven to never be wrong. I know some people have said that it was fake, but they're just weak. I know I'll be laughing at them when i'll be reliving TRON: Legacy over and over and over again, and they'll be busy collecting virtual hats/bitcoins.

A pretty hardcore game, like tron and a high speed shooter combined with drunken frisbee action and lots of neon lights, all it's missing is some catchy music from the nineties, rather enjoyable, involves throwing disc at people until they either fall to their deaths or have their heads cut off. One of Valve's hidden gems.

As I threw my first disk at another character my penis had grown a whole 5 inches to add to the already 2 inches length of my penis. This game combines Real Time Physics, with fun throwing elements that make the game extrememly amazing. It's too bad my computer exploded after playing this game because of how amazing it was, and NASA is now charging me for destruction of property. I joined a quick scoping Klan after getting a new computer and every time I put in a floppy disk to play this magnificient hunk of amazingness I get a tingly feeling down there that I've only experienced before with uncle phil. The Klan I joined mocked me for my low skill set, but I tried explaining the the complex system of this game that I guess they caught onto really quickly. The leader said "The game may seem like all you do is click and throw disks at some faggots, but its much more than that" and I am terribly greatful that valve decided to put the low pricepoint on this game.
